availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. Rogers (Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer and trader)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer and trader. Kentucky native. Married to Henrietta Rosemary Rogers in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on May 23, 1839. Father of James T. Rogers, Mary Rogers, Hiram C. Rogers, John Gano Rogers, Hugh Rogers, Samuel Clay Rogers. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1850. Farmer and trader in Bourbon County in 1860. Owned twenty-two enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860. Household owned one other enslaved person in Bourbon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 292B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 573.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 101B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 4, p. 314B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film #000183145, p. 218.
"William S. Rogers (1819-1895)," Find A Grave, Memorial #89876721, accessed May 20, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89876721.
